title: baiters/advance_fee/sources/scamorama/wanker_katty_tom.html
notes:
Update -- July 30, 2007
After the first exchange, there was a hiatus of several days in which I thought that the Lads had figured out they were being led astray (or they read Scamorama). Just when I figured all was lost, sure enough I get another message telling me I'd better hurry to another Western Union office to get my BMW on the next shipment. "Game On!", as Francis Begbie would say. Hence the transcript attached, and Arnold's fishing trip to Dead Yankee Creek, cunningly designed to coincide with a business trip that I was on, to explain the sparse communication from my end.

Sadly, in  one of the later messages, you'll notice that my next Western Union rep mistakenly signed his name "Hugh" instead of "Phil" (hey, what can I say... I was on my way to the morning presentation and stopped in a hurry to send out the message. They were most surprised ten minutes later in the talk when I clapped my hands to my head and screamed "Dammit!"). Hopefully they're stupid enough not to notice, and I've tried to minimize the damage by transitioning from Phil McCavitty to P. Hugh McCavitty. My guiding principle is never to underestimate my opponent, so I've assumed the worst and tried to tempt them back with a fake WU receipt that I'm actually somewhat proud of.

[...although (as usual) most of the messages from the scammers look like they're typed by a monkey on crack, they have a fake tracking company set up with a Web site that looks pretty good. It even takes the tracking ID they gave me and shows it as "in transit" ("on hold" since they found it remarkably difficult to pick up their Western Union transfer, but that's another story), while rejecting other random IDs. The site URL is http://www.globalexpresscours.co.uk ]

messages.body:
Hi Mrs. Tom,
 
Thank yall for answering so quick. Like I said before, I wish I could pay 
you the shipping charge like you asked for, but I went out last Thursday and 
got wicked drunk then done drove my pickup into a big ol tree on the way 
home, and I just paid the mecanic all the money I had left to get the front 
end fixed up. Is there any way you can like cut me maybe a discount on the 
fees? If I talk to the boys over at Sloshys Tavern maybe I can pull together

messages.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

I am in the process of sending a money transfer of $427 (transfer fees waived on agreement to open WUExpress acount)
from Mr. Arnold Wanker to Ms. Carol Downing. As you may be aware, since 9/11 there have been additional security 
measures implemented by the Commonwealth of Kentucky State Government in order to minimize the use of money transfer 
services for fraudulent and/or illegal purposes. 

The money transfer will proceed as soon as at least one of the following conditions is met: 

(1) I receive by e-mail a copy of the recipient's Kentucky Board of Taxation vendor registration form (Form KBT-11). If you are
not registered, and you or your representatives intend on regularly receiving money transfers from the State of Kentucky, I 
suggest that you complete this form and send it to the Kentucky State Government. Instructions for doing this are available
from their Web site http://www.ky.gov

or

(2) I receive by e-mail an image of the recipient, or delegated representative, clearly holding the icon attached. Please 
download and print the image, and have the recipient hold it in such a way that it is clearly visible in the photograph. No 
alterations or truncations must be present in the image. The icon has been chosen out of a list of 12 possibilities by the sender: 
this one is Paulie the Peckerfish, Kentucky's state mascot. 




My apologies in advance for any inconvenience these security measures may cause; I look forward to your earnest response
in order that I may expedite the money transfer without further delay. 

Best Regards
Hugh Janus
Customer Service Manager, Western Union, Choadtown, Kentucky

messages.body:
Dear Kathy,

I understand that Mrs Downing and yourself both have busy schedules. I also understand that it would be a serious burden to you if you had to provide a photograph with every money transfer you received. However, as I pointed out in my original message, this requirement is particular to the Commonwealth of Kentucky and presumably does not apply in most other jurisdictions. As I also mentioned, you can avoid this requirement in future by simply filing an application for a KBT-11 with the Kentucky State Government; you would then simply have to send a scanned copy of the KBT-11 each time. 

I apologize again for the inconvenience caused, but I would be in violation of Kentucky state law if I allowed the transfer to proceed without the state requirements being fulfilled. 

Regards

Hugh Janus 

Customer Service Manager, Western Union, Choadtown, Kentucky

messages.subject: Re: VITAL NOTICE
messages.body:
Hi Katty,

Its real good to hear from yall again. I was scared that yall had given up 
on the whole thing after whut happened with you and that guy from Western 
Union. Boy was he ever pissed when I went over to get my money back. Turns 
out he gots to give back the comishon he got from me opening that credit 
account thing. Aint gonna be goin back there again any time soon.

Now see, I hope yall can help me out here. So Monday, the dude from Western 
Union done give me  $427. Now I was feeling kinda down about the whole 
thing, so I done used some of that cash to buy some stuff, you know, for 
round the house. I got some of the good whisky, the one that comes in a real 
glass bottle. Plus they had squirel pie on sale, so I done stocked up on 
that also. Way I see it, you aint lived until you sat down with a squirel 
pie, some hash browns, and a good smooth sippin whisky. So long story short, 
I aint got all the $427 left any more. Fact is, I only got, lets see here, 
$305. Do yall want me to wait til I can raise some more, or should I send 
yall what I got now? Way I see it, I'ma have to find me a Western Union over 
the state line anyhow.

Thanks

Arnold

messages.body:
Dear Katty,
 
Thank you for your understanding. Living out here is depressing sometimes. I feel like
no-one really connects with me on the level that I need. What's it like where you're at? Do you ever feel the urge for unusual activities to pass the time? Would you be interested in meeting up some time - just you, me, and some inflatable companions? Please let me know if this is your sort of thing. I don't mind if you kept a personal copy of the picture also: I just don't want anyone this end to find out.
 
I will send you the copy of the payment slip as soon as possible. Unfortunately it's the Nathan Bedford Forrest festival this week, so my file system is inaccessible. I know you're in a hurry so I'll try to hack into it but it will take time. Hopefully by Thursday morning I should be able to send the copy of the slip..
 
Yours in animal husbandry,
 
Hugh

Hi Katty:

I still haven't received word from you about the things I talked about in the last message. I hope I wasn't too forward? It's just that since you saw that picture of me, I feel a connection with you that goes beyond the great distance between us. Rather than being shocked and disgusted, you were so tender and understanding. Please think it over. Once you've discovered the love of an inflatable animal, it's something that just has to be shared.

Please find attached the Western Union receipt for the transfer. I hope you've had a good Nathan Bedford Forrest Week over there.

Regards

P. Hugh McCavitty
